section.para: Represents one (of possibly many) inflected forms of the headword. Example: .

section.title: SQL
section.programlisting: create table inflectedForms ( entryID int foreign key references entries(id), inflectedTag varchar(10), text varchar(255), listingOrder int, id int primary key )

listitem.para: inflectedTag is an abbreviation, a code or some other string of text which identifies the inflected form, for example pl for plural, gs for genitive singular, com for comparative. You can use the tag datatype to explain the meaning of the inflection tags, to constrain which inflection tags are allowed to occur in your lexicographic resource, and to map them onto external inventories and ontologies.
The value of the inflectedForm object is the text of the inflected word itself.
listingOrder is the position of this inflected form among other inflected forms of the same entry. This can be implicit from the serialization.

The inflectedForm object is intended to model the inflectional morphology of a headword. To model derivational morphology, for example feminine forms of maculine nouns, the recommended way to do that in DMLex is to create separate entries for the two words, and link them using the Linking Module.
